statement.tex: \text{Find the integral of the function}\\ \dfrac{\cos x}{1+\cos x} \,

step.context: \text{Are the following calculations and analysis correct?}
step.reason:
\text{Applied the trignometeric identities, }\\ \cos x = \cos^2 \left( \dfrac{x}{2}\right) - \sin^2 \left( \dfrac{x}{2}\right) \, , \\ \cos 2 x = 1 - 2 \cos^2 x \text{ and } 1 + \tan^2 x = \sec^2 x \\
\text{Check your calculations, if you got something}\\ \text{else.}

step.context: \text{Is the following evaluation of the integral}\\ \quad \int \dfrac{1}{2} \left[ 2 - \sec^2 \dfrac{x}{2} \right] dx \quad \text{correct}?
step.reason: \int \sec^2 (ax) dx = \dfrac{\tan (a x)}{a}+ C \\ \text{where C is the constant of integration.}
